#Text=Michael Shen Fu-Tsung

#Text=Michael Alphonsius Shen Fu-Tsung , also Michel Sin , Michel Chin-fo-tsoung , Shen Fo-tsung , Shen Fuzong [ 1 ] ( Chinese : 沈福宗 ; pinyin : Shěn Fúzōng ; Wade – Giles : Shen Fu-tsung , died 1691 ) , [ 2 ] was a Chinese mandarin from Nanjing and a convert to Catholicism who was brought to Europe by the Flemish Jesuit priest Philippe Couplet , Procurator of the China Jesuit Missions in Rome .
#Text=They left Macao in 1681 and visited together Flanders , Italy , France , and England .
#Text=He later became a Jesuit in Portugal and died near Mozambique while returning home .
#Text=Visit to Europe
#Text=Flanders and Rome
#Text=Michael Shen Fu-Tsung arrived with Philippe Couplet by boat from Portuguese Macau in October 1682 .
#Text=They visited the city where Couplet was born , Mechelen .
#Text=They then left for Rome , where Couplet tried to obtain a Papal authorization to celebrate mass in Chinese . [ 3 ]
#Text=France
#Text=Michael 's Chinese name in characters : 沈福宗 ( " Shen Fu-Tsung " ) [ 2 ]
#Text=Shen was presented to King Louis XIV on September 15 , 1684 , and he demonstrated how to use chopsticks and how to write Chinese characters . [ 4 ]
#Text=He is described as participating in a royal dinner with Couplet , wearing green silk with deep blue brocade , decorated with Chinese dragons . [ 3 ]
#Text=They also visited the Maison royale de Saint-Louis , where they set up a display of Chinese silk portraits . [ 3 ]
#Text=England and later life
#Text=After his visit in France , Shen Fu-Tsung also went to Oxford where he met with Thomas Hyde in 1685 , [ 5 ] and he taught him some Chinese . [ 6 ]
#Text=Shen Fu-Tsung apparently communicated in Latin . [ 7 ]
#Text=Shen Fu-Tsung also met with King James II . [ 8 ]
#Text=It is the first recorded instance of a Chinese man visiting Britain . [ 9 ]
#Text=The king was so delighted by this visit that he had his portrait made , and had it hung in his bedroom . [ 9 ]
#Text=Shen Fu-Tsung was able to catalogue the Chinese books that were present in the Bodleian Library , and to describe their content , something which nobody had been able to do until then . [ 9 ]
#Text=He also showed the librarian the correct way to hold a Chinese book , starting with which way was up . [ 9 ]
#Text=Shen Fu-Tsung left England in 1688 and went to Lisbon , where he entered the Society of Jesus .
#Text=He died in September 1691 of a shipboard fever as he was returning to China , somewhere near Portuguese Mozambique . [ 1 ]
#Text=See also
#Text=Jesuit China missions
#Text=Arcadio Huang , another Chinese man who was active in France a few years after Shen Fu-Tsung .
#Text=Fan Shouyi , another Chinese scholar ( and later priest ) who visited Europe in the early eighteenth century .
#Text=Chinese diaspora in France
#Text=France-China relations
